body.p:
Living waters from above, and revivifying dew may descend upon the
dear and exalted, the high and eminent, the wonder of Jeshurun, the
wise and understanding, the great scholar, the excellent rabbi who
is here for praise and glory, our teacher Isaac, known by the name
of Lesser. Blessed art thou in the Lord, thou who art brave

Although it is a fact that I have not until now succeeded in
becoming one of your friends and acquaintances, nevertheless my
heart has made bold to approach you by means of a letter. For I
have heard of your reputation that you are straightforward with
respect to your people, and that in your case knowledge is mixed
with the wine of humility, so that you are friendly toward every
intelligent person, without regard whether he is of lowly station
or from among the princes of the earth. Then said I also to myself
let me come to him by way of a letter. For you know about a man
by the name of Wise, who is called a doctor (physician), but is
no more than a barber come to shave Israel. Now, the other day I
received a letter from a dear friend who lives in the city of
Cincinnati, in which he tells me about the doings of this man and
of his might, along with a man Goldstein, the miss-leader of the
Congregation of Louis Ville. Both of them seek to bring a new
Religion upon the People of God. Also this man Wise publicly
preached about the commandment of Halitza that it is not to be
observed outside of Palestine. We know that it is to be prac-
ticed outside outside of Palestine, but shall this man who never studied
nor ever learned except in a meeting-house of priests, know any-
thing about it? His sort of nonsense was never practiced either
in or out of Palestine. And like him there are many corrupters of
the Faith. Here is this man Goldstein who sings to the glory of
Wise, and composed for stanzas of a poem, each of which
begins with a letter of the name of “Mary” upon whom the new faith
is built. Of the like kind there are many. My friend also composed
a song about him. Here it is;
Hebrew A new tower and very high
Hebrew Built mostly of his folly and his lies,
Hebrew His hands are long and his teeth uncovered
Hebrew That is the rabbi of Cincinnati and its environs

My friend spoke at length to me about this accoursed man, and he
also prepared a poem for the shame of both of them. He placed Wise
at the beginning of the poem and Goldstein at the end. But I know
that you, my Master, are wise like an angel of God, and you will
know whether it is well to put this poem into your Occident to make
it known to many. If so, I shall bless you as well as the author of
the poem. I am sure that the words of the poem will please you.
For I am convinced of your goodness and you humility, and I know
that you will fulfill my desire, and I shall therefore make an
end to my words.

Thus are ended the words of your servant, the youngest of
the tribes of Judah.
Shochet of Congregation Beth El of Buffalo

If you would bless me with your mouth, or ? me with your pen,
here is my habitation, and here you will find me;
